alert.note: Alert for Callahan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 26 at 2:59PM CDT until April 26 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN CALLAHAN COUNTY... At 257 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Eula, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 255 PM quarter sized hail was reported in Potosi. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Eula around 300 PM CDT. Clyde around 305 PM CDT. Baird around 320 PM CDT. Putnam around 345 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Admiral and I-20 Near The Callahan-Eastland County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 296 and 323. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
